title: WCAS POLI_SCI 490-0-21 Special Topics in Political Science

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: For more information about this course, please contact the instructor directly via email.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Be familiar with the core debates in the Chinese politics field, be able to assess critically advantages and disadvantages of specific analytical perspectives, research and complete a small paper on some issue in the study of Chinese politics.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Eli Friedman Insurgency Trap: Labor Politics in Postsocialist China Ithaca: Cornell University ILR Press, 2014. ISBN: 9780801479311
Lily L. Tsai Accountability without Democracy: Solidarity Groups and Public Goods Provision in Rural China Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2007. ISBN: 9780521692809
Rachel E. Stern Environmental Litigation in China: A Study in Policy Ambivalence Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2013. ISBN: 9781107460027

Carlson, Gallagher, Lieberthal, and Manion (eds) Contemporary Chinese Politics: New Sources, Methods, and Field Strategies Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2010. ISBN: 9780521155762

Barry Naughton Growing out of the Plan: Chinese Economic Reform, 1978-1993 Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1996 - at least introduction, chapters 2, 6, & 8; remainder recommended. ISBN: 9780521574624

Susan L. Shirk The Political Logic of Economic Reform in China Berkeley: University of California Press, 1994. ISBN: 9780520077072

Kevin O'Brien and Lianjiang Li Rightful Resistance in Rural China Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2006. ISBN: 9780521678520

Dali Yang Remaking the Chinese Leviathan: Market Transition and the Politics of Governance in China Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2004. ISBN: 9780804754934

Andrew Mertha China's Water Warriors: Citizen Action and Policy Change Ithaca: Cornell University Press, 2008. ISBN: 9780801476686

Kevin O'Brien ed. Popular Contention in China Cambridge MA: Harvard University Press, 2008. ISBN: 9780674030619

Yongshun Cai Collective Resistance in China: Why Popular Protests Succeed or Fail Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2010. ISBN: 9780804763400

William Hurst The Chinese Worker After Socialism Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2009. ISBN: 9781107404625

Mary E. Gallagher Contagious Capitalism: Globalization and the Politics of Labor in China Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2005. ISBN: 9780691130361

Victor C. Shih Factions and Finance in China: Elite Conflict and Inflation Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2007. ISBN: 9780521106474

One of the Following 3 Required (students' choice):

Edward S. Steinfeld Playing our Game: Why China;s Rise Doesn't Threaten the West New York: Oxford University Press, 2010. ISBN: 9780195390650

Yasheng Huang Selling China: Foreign Direct Investment During the Reform Era Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2003. ISBN: 9780521608862

Thomas G. Moore China in the World Market: Chinese Industry and International Sources of Reform in the Post-Mao Era Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2002. ISBN: 9780521664424


One of the Following 3 Required (students' choice):

Avery Goldstein Rising to the Challenge: China's Grand Strategy and International Security Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2005. ISBN: 9780804752183

M. Taylor Fravel Strong Borders, Secure Nation: Cooperation and Conflict in China's Territorial Disputes Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2008. ISBN: 9780691136097

Alistair Iain Johnston Social States: China in International Institutions, 1980-2000 Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2007. ISBN: 9780691134536

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Following are recommended, but not strictly required:

# Yi-min Lin Between Politics and Markets: Firms, Competition, and Institutional Change in Post-Mao China Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2001. ISBN: 9780521604048

# David Zweig Freeing China's Farmers: Rural Restructuring in the Reform Era Armonk: M.E. Sharpe, 1997. ISBN: 9781563248382

# Kenneth Lieberthal Governing China: from Revolution through Reform New York: Norton, 2004 - chapters 2-7.

# Dali L. Yang Calamity and Reform in China: State, Rural Society, and Institutional Change since the Great Leap Famine Stanford: Stanford University Press, 1996.

# Mark W. Frazier The Making of the Chinese Industrial Workplace: State, Revolution, and Labor Management Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2002.

# Andrew G. Walder Communist Neo-Traditionalism: Work and Authority in Chinese Industry Berkeley: UC Press, 1986
